intro: Spuriopimpinella koreana, commonly known as Korean spurge, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. Spuriopimpinella koreana is often found in open habitats and is adapted to temperate climates.
